radiographic_examinations.findings: Calcifications revealed in the brain suggestive of tuberous sclerosis.
Worsening ventriculomegaly, increase in the size of the right foramen of Monro SEGA, and enhancing areas along the medulla, spinal cord, cauda equina, and leptomeninges.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased ventricle size and increased size of a subependymal giant cell astrocytoma at the foramen of Monro were noted.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Demonstrated a decrease in the size of the lateral ventricles.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Hydrocephalus was later revealed on a subsequent CT scan 10 weeks after surgery.
